Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: takeoutthetrash
Reviews.Content: Best service and rooms on the strip. Had a great overnighter before flying out on March Break, everyone was friendly and happy to see you as they greeted you with a smile. Restaurant had a wonderful selection for breakfast buffett, the gym was very well equipped and CLEAN! Shuttle to and from the airport leaves every half hour, both drivers were friendly and chatty, great first and last impression of the hotel. I will stay here again! Oh yes, my rate also entitled me to a $50 gas card from Petro-Canada, thank-you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianFlatlander
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March as we had an early flight out of Pearson for spring break to Cuba. The location is 3 minutes from the airport and typical of the Starwood brand. Rooms were average and we had no issues. Book the park and stay package and you won't be disappointed when you factor in parking at YYZ. Shuttle service was on time and exemplary, the driver explained how to get the shuttle to come back when we returned and where to wait. If your a starwood preferred member - you know what you are getting when you book at Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Verrosa
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome stay once again. Great people and great room. Definitely coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to costumer service”
Reviews.Author: HabsfanJez
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times in the past,and since I only started writing review not so long ago,I thought they deserve one too . Let me start by saying this.I live in Mtl and love the cold.So whenever I travel I always make sure to get a room where I can open the windows(yeah I do shut the hearing system off) and in the past,I checked out early from that hotel to check in in a lower quality hotel just coz I couldn't sleep in the room I was in at the Westin. But hey,I guess they took a note coz since then,I always one of the few that has a window that you can open ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: margsavon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while visiting friends. Hotel had some heat issues in the room but was very comfortable. Good location. Parking is a bit high

Reviews.Title: “You should expect more from a Westin”
Reviews.Author: hammer28calgary
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay at the Westin Bristol on a number of occasions over the last few years. The location is close to the Airport which is certainly a positive with a number of restaurants close by. The hotel has an inviting lobby with a very nice lounge and restaurant, however somewhat over priced with an average beer on tap for $12.00. The hotel team members are friendly and accommodating. My only challenge with this hotel is the HVAC system. On both visits I was in a higher floor and it was excessively warm at nights with no relief from the A/C system. I had asked the front desk to repair the system with no result. At times the room would of been 80-90 degrees with no windows with the system blowing warm air all night. My suggestion would be staying on a lower floor as it seems the temperature is much more manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick stay...”
Reviews.Author: asiepka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one evening on business -- found the hotel to be ok. Nothing special. The staff was great -- very friendly and accommodating. I took the shuttle from the airport to the hotel â€“ very easy. Check in was a breeze â€“ done in less than 5 minutes. Room was ok â€“ again, nothing special. The best part of the stay was the â€œheavenlyâ€� bed and shower. They are as described â€¦ heavenly! The internet situation was annoying â€“ charges were very high and they only allowed one complimentary hour in the lobby. Check out was also easy. The location does have some restaurants within walking distance. Great overall for a quick stay in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: 14Roger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the holidays and found the location to be very convenient and easy to acces. We were driving all over the city from North York, Thornhill, Mississauga, and Etobicoke. The hotel location was great for getting on and off different highways,etc. Parking is relatively inexpensive and the hotel offers an excellent value. There are also some restaurants within walking distance that we took advantage of. The hotel is a bit older but the room was clean and service was good. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for an airport hotel, don't believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Crabjunkie
Reviews.Content: I almost nixed this place, but I was zonked from traveling.and booked it anyway. The entire area around the hotel (at least in the winter) looks like a Soviet town from 1950. It's grey, cold, covered in snow, and unappealing. But, the hotel staff were friendly and very organized and efficient. The hotel was warm, the room was warm, spacious, and came with all of the Starwood amenities. The breakfast was great, quick, but a little pricey. I would stay here again if I needed to stay at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Super for a business function, rooms great too”
Reviews.Author: HRHofOC
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days for a business meeting. Very well organized for meetings and meals. Beds are amazing and the shower has a double head for an excellent shower experience. Shuttle service from the airport was efficient too. Excellent service and food make this a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1320
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself needed to be in Toronto on October 29, 2011 for business/pleasure. When searching for a hotel on Hotelclub.com I did locate the Westin for a good price. I paid for my room via that website. Upon arrival to the hotel I did provide my credit card for any incidentals which should have only been parking. When we left we did express check out by only putting the key in the drop off box and left. The next month when my credit card statement came and it showed a charge from the Westin for the entire cost of the room. I immediately called and was advised that it was an error on their part and my charge would be reversed within 3 days. Upon arrival of my next credit card statement the charges were still not reversed. I called the hotel again and the first representative advised me that they could not locate any information showing that I had paid for the room 2 times. They told me I would receive a call back from the manager that day which I never did get. I called back later that evening and spoke to another manager who did locate the mistake and assured me that I would be refunded. Sorry for the mistake and that was it. I have worked in customer service for over 10 years and I have to admit the service that I received during this mistake was totally unacceptable. This hotel will never see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great service”
Reviews.Author: MPRTraveler48
Reviews.Content: In November, my husband and I flew out of Toronto for a 30 day vacation. We usually stay at the Hilton Airport Inn on our night out and night back and leave our car with them on a park and fly package. This time they were booked. So, we tried the Westin Bristol Place at the Toronto Airport. They have an amazing parking package - the first night was only $169 with 14 or 15 days free parking. The return night was $139 with again another 14 or 15 days free parking. That gave us 28 or 30 days free parking with two room nights that were more than reasonably priced not to mention at the airport with free shuttle. The room was lovely, the bed amazing - what a great night sleep. The restaurant is very good and the staff is very friendly and service oriented. Who could ask for more? Well, we got more because when we returned we were informed that we were the "guest of the day" and were upgraded to a suite. We have definitely switched our allegiance from the Hilton Airport to the Westin Bristol Place. It's a very easy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent - not a full 4 star...and $$$$ parking! Also no bathroom for pool!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSusieQ7
Reviews.Content: If you opt to use the gym or the pool - BEWARE. There is no bathroom, no changeroom. So if nature calls when you're in the water, up to your room you go (or if you're younger or lazy, guess what..likely others end up taking a pee in the water). Same with the gym. If you're female like me, chances are you will need to use the bathroom during your workout. So again...up to your room you go. Ridiculous. Rooms are ok, though breakfast menu leaves much to be desired... The hotel is decent - don't get me wrong, but the whole gym pool setup left us really cheesed off!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Petercrooks
Reviews.Content: Effecient service, clean rooms tastefully decorated

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: SLPOL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin as we had an early morning flight. From the moment we arrived at the front doors to our departure we were well taken care of. We had our luggage taken from us upon arrival and delivered to our room. Front desk at check in was quick and easy. The room was clean, bathroom was well stocked with towels and bath products and the bed was very comfortable. The room was quiet and we did not hear any noise even though we were close to the airport. We had an issue with an in-room movie and staff were quick to resolve. Great location as we were at the airport in minutes. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near Airport”
Reviews.Author: ianjamesmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks whilst on business in Toronto (the office was near the airport) it's 5 mins drive from the airport but 30 mins drive from downtown. It's clean and the rooms are spacious, wifi cost is quite a lot ($15 for a day $49 for a week) but other than that it's a good hotel. Gym and pool are nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect venue for large events and a romantic getaway if so inclined”
Reviews.Author: Kaejae62
Reviews.Content: My first time at the Westin and I was not disappointed! I didn't know what to expect as I booked this weekend trip at the last minute. I am a network marketer for an awesome company called Isagenix, and Team Vision (Toronto group) was holding and event we call Super Saturday. I knew there was going to be alot of people at the event and I wasn't sure if this hotel would hold 550 people for an event! I called the number to book the room, and the girl that helped book my stay was wonderful! I am also a CAA member and between the event discount and my membership, I got a great deal on the price of my room! I booked a premium deluxe room, King bed. It saved me over $40 per night! The room itself was much larger, and offered complimentary WIFI, had a full size couch, a tub chair and large square coffee table, a working desk - was large enough so that I could spread out my paperwork and books - which was very handy as I not only came down for Super Saturday, but as a getaway working catch up weekend. Loved the fact that I had lots of towels! What a bonus! Shower head is amazing! Lots of water pressure and hot water! They also provided a blow dryer and toiletries! The pool is small, so is the fitness room, but still had excellent fitness equipment. The restaurant was excellent, especially the dinner menu. Staff were very friendly, helpful and went the distance to make you feel welcome! I will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “An overall excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: takeoutthetrash
Reviews.Content: Checked in for one night on the weekend and booked a premium deluxe room, King bed. The Westin is a short 5 minute ride from the airport and offers a complimentary shuttle. Considering the cost difference between this room and a regular King room was $20 it turned out to be a no-brainer. The room itself was much larger, offered complimentary WIFI, looked like it had been recently renovated and had a full size couch, a tub chair, working desk and well appointed bathroom with all the amenities one would expect from a Westin. I was surprised that there were 6 bath towels, and each was very new and soft. This room type offers views of the airport and included a terry-cloth bathrobe, mini-bar, in-room safe, starbucks coffee/maker and a flat-screen TV to round out the room. The bed was sooooo comfortable, I don't know why some other reviews said the opposite?!? Only problem with this type of room was that it is located adjacent to the elevators....something I always tend to avoid, however, I took the chance after seeing the room first~ couldn't hear a thing all night, a pleasant surprise! The pool is small, so is the fitness room, although well appointed, the main restaurant was excellent, especially the breakfast buffett. Staff overall were very friendly, helpful and went the distance to fulfill my requests. Parking overnight is $16, $2/half hour, cheaper than most other hotels directly on Dixon of the same caliber. Can't complain about a thing, I do reccommend this hotel, especially as a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “A Westin......Really?”
Reviews.Author: Harry P
Reviews.Content: I have come to expect stays at a Westin to be a comfortable quality experience. This was not. The room was not clean, the room smelled musty and i could also smell mould by my bed as well as when the taps are turned on in the bathroom. I mentioned it to the front desk staff and they committed to follow up on the issue by calling me on my mobile. This did not happen and upon my return, there was a humidifier type device buzzing by my bed all night long. Will never stay at this hotel again! A Westin......Really?

Reviews.Title: “still alive”
Reviews.Author: dom l
Reviews.Content: Was quite a dissapointing experience. I was booked at this hotel by my secretary for two nights. I decided to check out after the first day. The service was sub par and the room was not cleaned completely. These maids do not deserve a bonus. I found a dirty glass when i went to take my medication. There was dust on the countertop and around the television. My remote did not work and the front desk never sent me a replacement when I called. The worst part was the front desk clerk forgetting to log in my wake-up call. I was late for an important meeting with no apoligies from anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there all the time.”
Reviews.Author: Que-Nuck
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly for business. Over the years I've stayed in other Toronto airport hotels and I prefer the Westin Bristol Place for it's location, service and overall value for an airport hotel. Although the in-room service and food quality are good, you could easily walk to some very nice restaurants I.e. The Keg Steakhouse across the street. I always enjoy breakfast as they offer a very nice hot and cold breakfast buffet and the open concept restaurant has gorgeous skylights. As an SPG Platinum, you'll enjoy free wifi. Rooms are nice with typical heavenly showers and beds. The only negative for me is I can't seem to work the in-room thermostat (this is the case for every room). I can only control the fan speed. Increasing the tempature doesn't seem to warm up the room in the summer. Anyways, its never bothered me to the point of calling the front desk about it. I've always been very comfortable in the winter months. I think they control their AC output maybe... Staff is amazing. Pretty decent gym that offers headsets for use on it's treadmills. Overall, a second home for me.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Westin?”
Reviews.Author: paroncider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recommendation from someone and was rather disappointed. It's not what I've come to expect from other Westin hotels. The good: - The room furnishings were nice. - The heavenly bed was very comfortable. - The breakfast buffet is very good; get it included in your rate - Staff is very friendly - parking and wifi were included in my rate - Gym is very nice, with modern equipment - lobby is welcoming The not so good: - the hallways are run down, with wallpaper that was peeling at the seams. - The lights in the room were odd. There wasn't a central light switch by the door, so I had to fumble my way through the dark to the light by the closet or turn on one of the lamps on the desk. Turning on the weird fluorescent type light by the closet meant I had to go back there to turn it off at the closet, rather than control it by a switch at the bedside - overlooking a parking lot -- especially when staying there for 10 days! - I'm a SPG member and frequent traveller with SPG and wasn't offered a high floor - Walls are very thin; I could hear the family next door - the pool looks much better in the photos and isn't designed for swimming. It's only thigh deep in the shallow end, but about 2.5m deep in the deep end -- on a pool no more than 15m.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful establishment excellent staff !!”
Reviews.Author: kimmilil
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this establishment .Clean comfortable beautifully appointed ! Will most certainly be staying again. Forgot to pack ,of all things, my toothbrush (busy busy day ) and went to the front desk where they gave me one . How wonderful. Staff was very professional . . Just an overall wonderful experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect layover stay”
Reviews.Author: rajeshprem
Reviews.Content: As a SPG member, you would get to stay in the upper level rooms and they have a wonderful view of the airport. There is a free shuttle to the airport 24 hrs. There is a subway close by for 24hr food since the restaurants close around 11pm. The price was decent and Westin beds are one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Another disappointing Westin in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: steilkurve
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 3 Westins in Toronto: Harbour Castle, Prince and Bristol Place. Unfortunately, aside from the first one, they are not up to standards at all. I just stayed at the Bristol Place and like the Prince, it needs some major work. The Harbour Castle has done what was needed and that is gut the rooms and start from scratch. Not the case at the Bristol Place. Aside from the bathroom and the mattress, every else was dated and would have needed a replacement, especially the carpet. Old and sticky. And the room had a pretty strong moldy smell. Ditto with the hallways. On the positive side, room service was fast and food quite decent (although a first for me in a Westin, you can't order lunch in room!). The gym also had fairly treadmills. And staff was friendly. Unfortunately, that does not compensate for everything else around that needs a facelift. I'm a Starwood and Westin fan but I am worried how I feel they're letting the state of some of their properties falter. Hope they turn it around. In the meantime, I'll avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Westin, This is how it should feel.”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel... From the moment we were picked up by the shuttle driver we were always greeted by a smile and friendly as ever. You walk into the hotel and its a great sense of what Westin should be. The smell of their scent is so refreshing. Front desk staff is always in a good mood and there to help. This is the 3rd time we stayed before we go south on vacation and we will never stay anywhere else. Rooms are a great size and the bed is so Heavenly as they advertise. Now my wife wants one. We had a drink at the bar but no dinner as we already had plans, however from what the servers were bringing out it looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness and Quality”
Reviews.Author: 10sm
Reviews.Content: I have been using this hotel for more than 10 years. Everytime I find a truly friendly service. The hotel is very clean. The quality of breafast and restaurant is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you love Clean non moldy hotels”
Reviews.Author: badbella
Reviews.Content: Being a Westin I expected a Westin Hotel, not a black moldy disgusting dirty hotel, I have stayed in vegas hooker hotels cleaner then this one. We stayed one night on our way to Nassu, I figured we would pay the extra as I like nice hotels. We stayed on the 7th floor, the walls down the hallway were covered in mold and when you touched them they moved from wet rot, I was joking around about the wall falling away when we were sleeping. Our room looked dirty because of the carpet, I figured oh well one night won't kill me, though thoughts of bed bugs ran thru my mind. I go to take a shower and it looked ok till I got in and there was no hot water, it took about 10 mins to get it going, so I stepped in, looked down and there is a clump of black long hair, (I am blonde). Gross but this is the kicker on the mirror there was this big heart that was written by previous previous previous guests that showed up with the steam and how did I know it was old cause it was dated!!!!! I was going to go down and demand my money back but there was a giant line up and I thought screw it, I am going now on a nice vacation I will just post this on trip advisor and hopefully it will deter people from staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Smells Like a Kennel”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Mark12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on way to a family function. We noticed a couple of days prior to our departure that it was a pet friendly hotel. We called to ensure we would be located on a non pet floor and were told this was OK and a note would be put on our file. Upon check in the front desk we asked for a non pet floor. The man at the front desk said that the entire hotel was pet friendly! He said that all Westins are 100% pet friendly - every room - which means we have taken Westin OFF our list of hotels to stay in again. We were told if our room had any smell they would move us to another room. Luckily our room did not smell, however the hallways reeked of dogs. Smelled like a kennel - very gross. Too bad - a little dated but nice hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for stop over, with excellant service to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Cousinkk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a number of times and find it to be a great place to take off from for a trip/vacation. Service all round is great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel. Better than many”
Reviews.Author: CubaFun123
Reviews.Content: My shortest review ever. As my total states....I would stay again. It's like a mini westin. Great service and good location if you are out at the airport at a convention or trade show. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really impressed”
Reviews.Author: vanisletraveller101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin last week while attending a trade show in the area. Overall, this hotel is not a top class business hotel compared to some of the other options in the area. We got off to a bad start by having to wait 45 minutes for the shuttle from Pearon to pick us up. It never did appear (every other major hotel in the airport area had their shuttles picking up guests at the designated area), so we jumped on the Marriott's shuttle and walked over from that hotel. Which was ironic, given that we usually stay at the Marriott but had decided to try the Westin this trip. Check in was fine. Staff offered up a half hearted apology about the shuttle, but still managed to place the blame on us, saying we needed to call first. Room was OK at best. Leaking tap (leaking up through the hot water faucet onto the vanity), loose shower head and various minor repair issues, but nothing outrageous. In general, there is a feel of disrepair throughout the common areas of the hotel. The lobby features a lot of brass fixtures, but nobody has polished them seemingly for months. The doors of the elevators have not seen the working end of a cleaning brush for eons. Again, nothing to make you go running out into the streets with your hair on fire, but not up the business class hotel standards. Staff at the breakfast restaurant were outstanding. We have stayed at quite a few Westins (the Seattle Westin and the W in Barcelona are two of our favourite hotels in the world), but we will not be returning back to this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A/C not working well”
Reviews.Author: milty908
Reviews.Content: One of the most uncomfortable stays in any hotel. A/C wasn't really working. I can feel the cold air but the fan just couldn't bring it out. Room was at an uncomfortable 76-78 degrees the whole time. Yes $15 parking and $15 Internet isn't nice, but at least make the stay comfortable... I asked for a fan at 2am because I didn't feel like asking for a room change anymore. They brought over a tiny $5 fan that didn't really deliver air anywhere, pretty much useless. I wouldn't stay here again. Even the Four Points is much better. Oh and the carpets were pretty bare and dirty. Not up to Westin qualities at all.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Bluejayssuck
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived late afternoon into Pearson and stayed at the hotel overnight before going Downtown the following morning. Room was clean and tidy. My only grumble is the recent craze of charging extra to park at the place $15 they may as well wear a mask and point a gun at you. Same with no breakfast included in the price. It ain't the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Pets are welcome in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Angie1202
Reviews.Content: Did not know that all rooms were allowed for pets accommodation. My daughter has asthma, did not know cats stayed in the rooms. Only to find out she started to cough alot. I was informed that it was a pet friendly hotel , wished rooms were separated to accommodate pets and others were without pets. Also the toilet had black stains inside, my kid would not sit down on the toilet thinking a "monster" was there. Staff was very friendly and tried to help but could not move due to time.

Reviews.Title: “Still Classy”
Reviews.Author: fdl1
Reviews.Content: Above average Airport Hotel because of the helpfulness and number of staff available, even at odd hours. It was very humid in Toronto when we stayed, and the fresh, fruit-infused water available in the lobby was a nice touch. The rooms were very quiet and comfortable, and the flat-screen tv's were great. Only issue: WiFi was $15+. Considering that even budget motels can throw this in, it feels like a bit of a cash-grab.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick stop”
Reviews.Author: spinard
Reviews.Content: I know this place gets bad reviews, but I liked it. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The parking gates could be improved a little so they work better. The Keg Steakhouse is directly across the street which is one of my favorite steakhouses, so I was happy about that. We had a room facing the airport and I couldn't hear any planes at all the whole night. The staff was pleasant enough, I had no issues at all staying at this hotel. I was actually worried based on the reviews here, but for the price I paid which was about $100 I was very happy. I would return if I was in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean as a Whistle!”
Reviews.Author: Ladydi120888
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for the duration of a hockey tournament. At first when I heard we were booked with an airport hotel, I figured nothing outstanding or extraordinary, will smell of smoky travelers, etc., but boy, was I wrong! From the moment you set foot in this place, you can't help but notice how spotless the entire lobby area was. The front desk staff was courteous and helpful and quickly provided us with carts for our luggage, in spite of our extremely late arrival. Upon reaching our room, I have to say that this was the cleanest smelling hotel room with the cleanest sheets and towels (very soft, too) that we have ever been in. We were impressed enough to take such notice!! The location is perfect and within walking and/or driving distance to many of the places we frequented. Re: Value, they had an ongoing promotion that offered a great rate for our stay. The only negative comment I had was the wi-fi internet availability. I would expect a hotel of this stature to offer such service on a complimentary basis, without a fee. Many places do nowadays. Nonetheless, should we find ourselves returning to Toronto for the same type of trip, we will be more than glad to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very bad”
Reviews.Author: Jonbarteaux
Reviews.Content: Shuttle was nice. Lobby was fantastic decorated. arrived from a late flight at 10 pm with a 3 year old. staff was disengaged and we waited to check in for 15 minutes. hotel staff that could have opened another check in were standing around. employee at the counter when my turn looked beyond me and said " whoever is next in line please" i was the last person so actually really rude. Also wanted id for my credit card even though i had booked online in advance and did not ask the 4 guest in front of me for id. Room was gross and old; no mini bar stuff and water and pop in the lobby was 4 dollars a bottle. hotel is dark and dingy and stinks. parking system was broken and staff did not seem to care. Really robotic disengaged staff which was weird as they were all the same way. Food however was actually pretty fantastic. room service burger was phenomenal and breakfast was amazing. Not a nice place, stay somewhere else and go there for the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Park, Stay & Fly”
Reviews.Author: sandpiperII
Reviews.Content: We flew out of Toronto to Mexico and utilized the Westin for a park, stay and fly hotel. Our experience was wonderful. We have stayed at several other hotels in the area, however, none have gone as smooth as the Westin. The staff is wonderful, friendly and helpful. Parking was right in the hotel lot (which is a plus) and was easy in and out. The hotel I believe is older but in very good shape. Nice bright pool area. The rooms were clean - smaller bathrooms - beds were comfortable and the price was great. I would truly recommend this hotel for a park and fly. The shuttle service was on time - comfortable and the best part was we called as soon as our plane landed and by the time we received our luggage and we out at the "stand" they told us to be waiting at...the shuttle was there. It truly was easy - no stress. We have stayed at other hotels and have waited and waited for the shuttle to come - sometimes when it is cold and snowing. You can't go wrong with staying at the Westin. There is a restaurant right in the hotel. Starbucks coffee and to go cups were in the room - so even thought we took the 3:30 a.m. shuttle....we had a delicious cup to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Johnquardt
Reviews.Content: Great property with courteous and helpful staff. Rooms are spacious, clean and have been recently updated which is nice. And of course, with all Westin properties, the beds are heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “Great for park and stay”
Reviews.Author: dennisc1
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel 4-5 times a year for Toronto airport trips. The rooms are modern,updated and clean, the beds are very comfortable.The front desk staff is very professional.The shuttle service is convenient and always pick us up quickly after a call from the baggage claim. If you need a hotel to park your car and spend the night for a Toronto airport trip,the Bristol is the Place.

Reviews.Title: “I would expect more”
Reviews.Author: sallan71
Reviews.Content: If a great lobby is important then this right up there.... The rooms though are average and the bathrooms extremely small and lacking. Using the pool in the winter is interesting as the air feels like you are outside and makes it quite uncomfortable. The opposite could be said about our room where it was incredibly warm and could not cool it down. Then to top it off charging an incredibly ridiculous amount for every wireless Ip you may need in your room. Expected much more

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at Toronto airport; ranks low as a Westin”
Reviews.Author: letsmakeadeal
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel in the last couple of months. The colleague who recommended it described it as the best hotel at the Toronto airport and the worst Westin he'd ever stayed in. I think both are true. There's nothing wrong with this hotel. It is quiet despite being at the airport. The beds are terrific. The rooms are perfectly OK. The bathroom was fine. I had no problem with the heat. It's very close to the airport. I've asked for little from the staff, but they've been fine. I'll stay there again this month. But, it doesn't have the glitz or positive edge that I associate with Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Service issues-billing issues-heating issues-Stay away from here”
Reviews.Author: phillyphlyer40
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the (formerly Wyndham) Westin Bristol Place. The only thing that makes this a Westin is the name/signs. The rooms/service/staff/hotel in general are NOT up to Westin brand standards as I have come to know in many previous Westin stays. I actually had a "downgraded" room as a SPG platinum member-was booked into a king room, requested a suite. I got a regular room with 2 double beds, as they were sold out. When i got to my room i noticed it felt like the temperature was about 55 or so! This was late September, and it was upper 60's outside! I turned the thermostat up to 80 (as high as it would go) but only freezing cold air blew out of the vents. After 20 minutes, I called the front desk, and they told me they would send someone up to fix my heat! 15 more frigid minutes passed, until a tech responded. He had in his hands a little space heater (VERY UNSAFE!) and told me they only have a/c in the hotel (IN TORONTO???) and that I would need to use the space heater for heat. (This concerned me, as I would rather get sick then die in a fire!) I plugged in the heater, and turned off the a/c. The room eventually did get to about 66 or so! I froze that night..and left in the morning. Staff response was a shrug of the shoulder at this! I also had billing issues (hotel shows up at Wyndham on my amex bill) that have not been resolved. When I called the GM about this issue-and he didnt return my calls until I called him back 3 additional consecutive times, he told me "I have a hotel to run" and he couldnt be "bothered with this minor issue"! Overall, I will never return to this hotel, and would advise anyone else not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disapointing for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: cooljul29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disapointment to me. The rooms and hallways were dated. The washroom in my room was awful. The toilet had rust-marks in it, and ran non-stop. Most disapointing was the maid service. I left my room at 7:30 a.m one morning, with no sign on the door, and returned at 6:30 p.m to find the room was not cleaned. When I complained to the maid service, they assumed no responsibility and said I must've had the do-not disturb sign on the door.(which I did not, since I was there on buisness). This experience reminded me of what you would normally expect from an older privately owned motel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: sti_stage2
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't too bad. It is located in close proximity to the 401, which makes it easy to find. The area is fairly quiet, surrounded by other hotels. The parking was a great price and allowed in and out privileges. The lobby was large and clean and the staff were kind. We were booked in for a room with 2 double beds, but we were able to upgrade to a king sized bed. The room was a good size and the view was nice. The carpeting appeared slightly stained and the walls looked dirty, but other than that, the room was good. The sheets were comfortable to sleep in. Despite setting the air conditioning to a comfortable temperature, it stayed on high for the whole night. We had to turn it off by 2:00am because it was getting extremely frigid. Thank goodness for the thick duvet. The housekeeping was excellent. The only complaint we have is that hallway noise was extremely audible from within the room. On our second night, a few people had come back from a party, and were intoxicated. We were able to hear their whole conversation as they congregated in the hallway and banged doors for a good half an hour. At 3:30am, this abrupt awakening was more than unpleasant. Though, this wasn't the hotel's fault, it made for a grumpy start to the morning. Airplanes were also audible through the window. The Sheraton at the airport definitely had better insulated windows. The washroom was nice, and included a dual head shower. We recommend this hotel if you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Toronto Airport”
Reviews.Author: Trustingtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a well maintained property, located close to the Airport and perhaps easier to get to terminal 1 than the Sheraton airport.. We found the price of this hotel reasonable and the shuttle bus opertaor vary helpful. Aircraft noise was not a problem. There is nothing in the neighbourhood except hotels and gas stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for meetings”
Reviews.Author: hukeshc
Reviews.Content: Great place for meetings, closer to Airport and shopping. Great restaurants in the area

Reviews.Title: “Good value for stopover.”
Reviews.Author: eatondog
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a stopover before an early morning flight. We booked through Priceline and got a great rate. We called the hotel and requested adjoining rooms, king beds and one crib and that is exactly what we got. Good size rooms but you do hear doors closing in hallway and airplanes through the night. Did not eat there or use the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off advertising”
Reviews.Author: kenmore24
Reviews.Content: Advertised with a link from the recent Toronto Wine and Cheese Show as both having a shuttle service included and free parking for show attendees. Upon parking and checking in several clerks advised us no free shuttle or free parking as our reservation was made on their Internet Web Site where the free parking offer was displayed. No effort made to appease us - apparently customer is never right even with the printed proof of their adverting. It cost us $12.00 each way plus tip ($15.00) for cab fare and $16.00 parking. Strongly urge you avoid this hotel. Also the bathroom and particularly tub is extremely cramped for this star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Travelista11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through priceline which we thought was a good deal. Unfortunately we did not get much as sleep as we heard every door shut and every 'ding' of the elevator throughout the night. Also, our bathroom smelled like smoke and it was a non-smoking room. Parking was $16 and I was charged twice (don't pay at the gate as they will probably charge your room). I had to leave 5 voicemails and email the company before anyone called me back and the guy was actually quite rude. The accountant told the company he hadn't received any of my voicemails...which did not surprise me judging by his lack of personality or care on the phone. The hotel was beautiful but I would not return to this Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Park n' Fly”
Reviews.Author: JaneDoe71185
Reviews.Content: I, unfortunately, booked my one night stay through Priceline with the understanding parking was included. Apparently it is not and will cost me about $20.00 a dayl I thought I got a good rate on Priceline but certainly not if you add $160.00 (plus taxes, etc.) to it. NOTE: no matter what the reason is, you can't cancel through Priceline. I, obviously, didn't read the fine print. Bottom line - book through hotel directly. They seemed very nice when I called to find out the cost. Regardless, we won't be able to post a review of the hotel as we can't afford to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for park-and-stay”
Reviews.Author: lotzasmiles
Reviews.Content: Very nice lobby. Rooms are clean - comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. We stayed here the night before our vacation because the "park-and-stay" package was cheaper and more convenient than airport parking ($125-$135 for Sun night stay + one week parking). Very close to the airport. Walking distance to many restaurants including Lone Star. The parking lot is safe but could be lit up better. The shuttle service to and from the airport is quick and on-time.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: A good Westin. The lobby is really nice with the stone wall, the waterfall and a nice siting area. The front desk personnel was really nice, smiling and efficient. A nice and warm welcome always helps to feel good. The room was modern was the signature decor and tones of Westin. The working desk and chair were perfect. The bed was heavenly... The best in the business and one of the best reason to go to Westin. The breakfast buffet had a large selection of good food incluant healthy choices.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Experience”
Reviews.Author: Egyptian-Advisor
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport. Not a lot of things to do. Some nice Resturants on a walking distance. Quite few shopping malls 20 minutes away. Stuff are not the best I have met.

Reviews.Title: “More than met my expectations. May I come back? :)”
Reviews.Author: Ohio2009Ohio2009
Reviews.Content: After a long but enjoyable week, long day, and less-than-perfect directions to the hotel, we were pleased to encounter such friendly and helpful staff. Upon checking into our room, we found we had a gorgeous view. The room may have been updated, and it was very roomy, very modern and the beds extremely comfortable. We were hungry and found that there was a restaurant on site where we received great service. At about 9 or 10 p.m., there was a full menu available, and the food itself was delicious. All in all, I would say that my one night's stay at the Westin was the most positive, and certainly the most relaxing, of the five nights we spent in Canada. Did I say the beds were comfortable? So were the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TammyH81
Reviews.Content: My pillows were dirty, there was no light bulb in the lamp. There was an incident with the police and a restless guest that I felt was handled poorly. I will not return

Reviews.Title: “Not up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: bargainhunter36
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the pricier ones I've ever stayed in and the it just wasn't up to my expectations. Our room was way, way down the hall, a long walk with a lot of luggage, which would have been okay if the room we were checked into was our room. We opened the door to discover that someone else's stuff was in the room. (Luckily they were out and not in the shower or something!). We dragged all our stuff back to the check in desk and waited in a very long line ...again. There was no appology and then there was no room ready for us. It was 5pm. So we had to wait around in the lobby some more while they had a room cleaned and ready for us. Still no appology. Our room, finally, was fine and quiet, but the level of service was not up to a 4-star hotel for us. The food was okay, but rather expensive for what it was. There are better places on the Airport strip for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TFTtraveller
Reviews.Content: Travelling with our dog, Charlie, my partner and I decided to spend a couple of days in Toronto. When I looked at prices in the downtown area, I almost fainted. Luckily, this hotel had an awesome deal. Extremely quiet. Nice view of the runway. Gorgeous lobby! Plus, Charlie got his own Heavenly Bed, a Westin mat with a large stainless water and food bowl set, and his own little goodie bag! All the extras were free of charge, too. The self parking is close and easy, and it was only CN$14 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: JasonYSB
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a number of times, and are consistently satisfied (especially when weekend rates are often around 99$ CDN). Guest rooms are standard Westin, with great beds. It's evident the building is old and has been renovated, but it seems like they might have cut some corners (especially noticeable in the bathrooms, and with some of the furniture). Still a good choice overall, especially if you're flying in or out of YYZ.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GtWinner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for a few days, the rooms are clean, updated amenities, very friendly and helpful staff...They recommended a great breakfast place and its my new. FYI, its more than 20 mins from downtown.....I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Park N Fly”
Reviews.Author: suburbandiva
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Preferred Guest and always use the Bristol Place when I am flying out of Pearson Airport. The Park N Fly is a great price and the shuttle service is very convenient. The beds and bath are great and I find that it is the perfect way to start my vacations.

Reviews.Title: “great for stop overs”
Reviews.Author: wendy1461
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed at the Westin when overnighting in Toronto between trips. The location of this hotel is ideal for overnight stopovers. The rooms are neat and clean with modern amenities. Room service was prompt and very tasty with reasonable prices. If you don't want Hotel food, there are several restaurants in the same block including The Keg, Denny's and Subway sandwiches next door. There is a nice gym and pool which we made use of after a long trip from Australia. The staff were very friendly and allowed us to leave a bag when we went to Mexico....it saved us carrying our winter clothes to Mexico. Thankyou Westin Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Bristol Place Jan 29, 2009 and found the hotel to be very good. We were heading to St. Lucia for a week and took advantage of the Westin's park and fly package which included 1 nights stay and a full week of parking for about $150 CAD. The price was comparable to most other airport hotels, and gets you some of the nice Westin perks. We didn't have any trouble finding good parking spaces as some of the other reviewers noted, but this may have just been good luck on our part. The parking is outdoors, which can be a negative in the winter depending on weather. The room and bathroom were very clean and well kept. The bed was comfortable and the Westin "Heavenly Bath" was great as usual. The room featured a floor-to-ceiling window overlooking the city. We were given a room on the 14th floor so the view was amazing. The stay was great overall. The only minor issue we had was that our wakeup call came 30 minutes late. We were already up so it didn't affects us, but given this is an airport hotel, you should be able to count on the call. Overall, we would recommend the hotel for airport travel. We've stayed at a number of other Toronto airport hotels and this one has been our favourite so far.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin's standards.”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Preferred Guest and I have visited quite a few Westin hotels and I was very disappointed by that one. It is an older property that has been renovated but not everyhting has been done. Don't let the website photos fool you. It has real dark hallways with old elevators with aged walls. The room was okay. The furniture is new as well as the LCD flat screen TV. The bed was good. We had no lights in our washroom and the light bulb in the bed lamp was burnt out as well. The WORST thing has to be the parking problems... We had checked-in at 2:00pm but went out until 9:00pm... Once we returned to the hotel at night, the hotel parking was full due to a function they had and even valet parking could not take our car.... So , here we are back at our hotel with a parking we paid for but we can't park.... The hotel front desk sent us to a nearby car wash where we could leave our car... NOT GOOD. I now know that you can park and fly and leave your car at the hotel, that may explain why it is that full. Anyways, at the Westin, you expect to have a spot for your car. They finally removed our parking charge but nothing else was done to make up for that mess... WILL NOT RETURN. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: silverfoxsgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bristol on an overnighter in order to fly out from the airport in Toronto on an early flight. Booked through our travel agent and got a great deal which included free parking for the week. A fabulous place to rest your head for a night or two with great staff and nice comfy rooms. We enjoyed drinks in the lobby bar and dinner at a conveniently located Keg restaurant right across the street. Loved the wonderful shower and really nice bath products. Also loved the added touch of lemon water available in the lobby. Would definately stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: QPR_4_ever
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bristol Place is as you would expect slightly more upmarket than many chains. It is easy to find just off the highway and exhibits the usual frills , valet parking etc. The people at the front desk were very helpful both at check in and when I booked an extra night as got snowed in. There is both a formal restaurant and a more casual bar area, both of which are very comfortable , spacious and relaxing. The staff are very friendly and accomodating and the food is good , with all the touches of a gourmet chef and as a result probably a little over priced. Right next door is a steakhouse which I personally would recommend for larger portions and a lower price , but still maintain quality. The rooms are very comfortable with HD flat screen TV , wet bar etc. The only draw back is that the heating in the room either did not work or else could not be controlled as the heat stayed on all night at 70 which for me was way too much and let to a coupe of restless nights sleep. All in all though it is a great stay if a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient toronto pearson hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProGeo
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have stayed to the Westin Bristol Place Toronto Airport Hotel for 2 nights. It was the first 2 nights of our 3 weeks honeymoon to central and north America (Canada,New York and Cuba). We decided to stay to this hotel because of its location near the airport. We were transferred from the airport to the Hotel by free shuttle. The room was very clean, spacious, new furniture, soft and xl double bed and a wonderful view to the airport. We didnâ€™t use any other facility of the hotel than the room. The staff very helpful and friendly. In the one and half days of our stay to Toronto area the one was spent at the Niagara Falls (you must not miss it) and the other half to Toronto. If you are searching for a convenient, nice hotel near the toronto airport, I think that you have found it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but not so friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roxyster
Reviews.Content: Being a user of tripadvisor for a long time. I think it is time to contribute to the community. Stay there for a night. Very lovely hotel. Good: You will know the different when you step in the hotel... breath the fresh... fresh flowers everywhere in the lobby. Quiet hotel which is v. close to the airport. Large room with a nice long working desk. Free bottles of water. (spg floor only maybe?) Bad: Staff did not greet or say hello when check in. wi-fi costs a fee. Parking costs a fee when other hotels park free. Nothing to see around. Housekeeper knocked the door @ 9am. Overall: Great value with good sleep. Food is not cheap around the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place..Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Truckerbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. It is really nice hotel and the staff were very friendly. I worried about it since I got the hotel on hotwire and since it was the first time doing that I was unsure of how I would be treated. It was great and I got the hotel very cheap compared to the hotel website. $14.00 bucks a night for parking. Super great bed for a good night sleep and the room is bery quiet for being so close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds, Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Zife
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Westin Bristol Place in Toronto, and it has been a great stay both times. We checked in and got in the Starwood Preferred Guest rooms because we have the Starwood Preferred Guest 'points' and they put our friend in one of the Preferred rooms next to us, even though he isn't part of the program. The Heavenly Beds at this hotel are absolutely amazing. They are easily the most comfortable beds that my wife and I have ever had at a hotel (in fact, it's more comfortable than our bed at home). The pool is nice, but not overly large, and I wouldn't exactly call it "heated." Also, it closes at 11:00 (if I remember correctly), so late night swims are out of the question. The only thing keeping this from being a 5-star review from me is that the hotel website states that check-out time is 1:00pm, while the hotel itself has it listed as 12:00pm. When we asked the front desk what the check-out time is, they said 12:00. When we mentioned that the website said 1:00, they simply said that "it doesn't really matter." Overall, I'd definitely recommend the hotel, even if it's a bit out of your way. I don't think you're going to find a much better hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: martythemonkey
Reviews.Content: On the whole the hotel was not bad! The rooms are great and recently renovated with flat screen TV's. I found the rooms to be quiet and comfortable. The restaurant was by far the best feature of the hotel and lived up to it's reputation. The only problem I encountered at the property was the parking. After three trips to the desk I still could not get a key to let me out. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: drummerhill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the The Westin Bristol Place Toronto Airport for one night in May. No issues! Nice room and great service! I did the Park/Stay and fly option.... easy access to Pearson Airport and was picked-up at Terminal 1 in a timely fashion on my return (the driver even took me directly to my car in their lot when I got back). Nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Smlswftbrds
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the duration of the Outdoor Adventure Show. Overall it was very nice and VERY cleanâ€”once we got a proper room. The first room we stepped into was SOAKED and smelly. What I gathered was there was some sort of party and the room was still drying out. OK, no big deal, mistakes are made. The room we ended up was very, very nice. Clean, nice towels and bathroom. Nice flat screen tv. The beds are awesome in every regard. Very comfortable and clean. These beds had the cleanest-looking linens I've ever seen in any hotel. Comforters and all. And the comforters are white. The wi-fi access is way too expensive which is irritating. And the parking lot was the worst! I couldn't believe the amount of snow and ice that had been left in that lot. We got out of the car and my son immediately slipped and fell. I can understand if it had just been snowing but it was my understanding that all the snow and ice were from a couple weeks prior. The workout room was also very nice with modern equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on the Westin...”
Reviews.Author: madstal
Reviews.Content: When I think of the name WESTIN, I expect that it is going to be a GREAT hotel. Otherwise I would stay at the HoJo, Best Western, or a Holiday Inn. Unfortunately I don't believe this truly lived up to my expectations. We arrived at this hotel after flying back into the country. We were met with a messy unplowed parking lot which was from a storm 2 days earlier! Then we learned it is $14 to park in this disaster area. I ended up parking 4 rows out in a spot where I felt I wouldn't be stuck when I went to leave. Again - NOT what I would expect from a Westin. I explained this to both the Bellman when we entered, and the Customer Service Manager at checkin, and again at checkout. All of it laughed off or fluffed off. The room itself was quite nice. The only "minor" issue was when you are in the tub you see all the pipes underneath the sink - I can't figure out why they would not cover that counter area up! The bed was great, the LG LCD tv excellent, and overall felt very comfy. Immediately after checkin my wife called down to the front desk to request a late checkout of 4pm and was told this would be taken care of. Then the day of we were questioned by them on the phone after Noon, and again a tap on the door from the maid around 1pm. Apparently no one got the message?! As well I am a Starwood Preferred Guest. I was never offered any Starwood room, upgrades, anything.... Everytime I have stayed at a Sheraton (same Starwood Group), I was always treated better. Would I go back - SURE if the price was right. However hard to justify in excess of $200 for a night for mediocore service.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than before”
Reviews.Author: Vickie_Bernie
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here a few times when it was the Wyndham and was so disappointed that I refussed to have my organization book me there again. So when I was informed I was staying there again I was a little concerned. I am happy to say it is completely different. Room is a great size, and lots of room to store things. Their new air conditioning/heating works wonders, as this was always a problem before. I found the ac to be very quiet and efficient. Bedding is like sleeping on a dream. I did encounter one problem and that was that the duvet cover was filthy, dirty and marks all over it, and some blood where it looks like someone may have cut themselves. A quick call to housekeeping go the duvet changed. Every room has a flat panel LCD and large desk. I was disappointed that you couldn't get free internet, but I purchased it for $12.50 for 24 hours. I believe you can get it in the lobby with wireless for free. Bathrooms have been renovated but you can tell this is an older hotel. My one observation was they renovated all these rooms; but they didn't replace the doors to the rooms or the closet/bathroom doors. Your room door slams shut and you can hear everyone else's room door slam too. The elevators are old and slow still. Breakfast in the restaurant was quite good and service was great. I had the buffet for around $20 which included hot food, if you just get cold food it is cheaper. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions I had. The shuttle is very efficient, but unless you know that you have to phone the hotel to get them to pick you up at the airport you could wait for a while. Overall this hotel is great and I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Zachary's restaurant, nice room, Pet Friendly - we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: pwrshift
Reviews.Content: This used to be a Wyndham hotel very close to Toronto's Pearson Airport but it's now a Westin (Starwood). It's pet-friendly but they don't have any dog walk areas at present. They provided a cute heavenly doggie bed, dishes and treats for our dog and no extra fees. Our room was very nice size with flat-screen 32" TV and 2 queens with only one occasional chair other than a desk chair. I think the king room would have given better seating for two people with a small sofa. As we had our pooch, we ordered room service but the menu was very limited. The person taking the order knew that and said we could order from the Zachary's restaurant instead, brought the menu to the room, and it was superb - perhaps the best room service meal we've ever had. I would go back just for that experience. The American breakfast the next morning was very good. We had a weekend rate of $99. Valet parking was $5 more than self-park so we did that. Like I've found in a lot of Westin's the air-conditioner was a problem - it shuts off when there is no movement in the room (like sleeping time) and you wake up sweating - then it gets too cold and it's difficult to adjust.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is now a Westin - nicest hotel near Toronto airport”
Reviews.Author: MTLGAL
Reviews.Content: My meeting was at the Renaissance, but it was booked, so I stayed at the Westin. I remember this hotel used to be the Wyndham, but I don't know when it changed. The room I had was on the small side, but very nicely furnished and it was renovated. My only complaint in the room was that there was no desk! When I told the check-in clerk, he informed me that since this room is a different shape, they need a special shaped desk, which hasn't arrived yet. Mini bar is absolutely outrageously priced, so avoid! Nice LCD TV on the wall! There is a pool and fitness, but I didn't check it out. Parking is $14/day Restaurant - I had the breakfast buffet for $14 - it was fantastic, tons of fresh fruit, oatmeal, all the hot dishes you expect, and served til 11 am. Overall I think this hotel is great, and definitely my first choice for the Toronto airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: rro
Reviews.Content: When I reviewed the hotel on their website, I was disappointed that my group had decided to stay there, but my opinion changed upon arrival. The exterior of the building is prefabricated concrete, but the interior, the part that matters, was rich woods and natural stone. The rooms all have this nook where the window is, which increases the size of the room compared to the standard hotel room. The main draw is obviously for business travelers coming through Pearson. The business centre is exactly what they promise, and the wifi is not budget. The pool and fitness area were underused, so I felt very comfortable there. The skylights are a nice touch. The shuttle to the airport was convenient and the hotel staff were more than courteous when dealing with bags.

HotelInfo.Name: Westin Bristol Place Toronto Airport
